body_html:
Thanks @caisq and I have test the python3 docker image. It works like a charm with Python 3.4.3 and latest TensorFlow. You can run by docker run -i -t tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-py3 bash.

But the binary python doesn't exist. It would be better to link python3 to python.
body_text:
Thanks @caisq and I have test the python3 docker image. It works like a charm with Python 3.4.3 and latest TensorFlow. You can run by docker run -i -t  tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-py3 bash.

But the binary python doesn't exist. It would be better to link python3 to python.
body:
Thanks @caisq and I have test the python3 docker image. It works like a charm with Python 3.4.3 and latest TensorFlow. You can run by `docker run -i -t  tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-py3 bash`.

![screen shot 2016-12-02 at 09 17 53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715000/20819590/49d6ed22-b870-11e6-9b20-4c30572a1224.png)

But the binary `python` doesn't exist. It would be better to link `python3` to `python`.
